TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
> Half correct; I don't care if the M7 is empty when it lands, as the Hohmann transfer home is in about a year so there's plenty of time to refuel on the surface. I just want to make sure I have plenty of fuel for the descent, both to keep out of the "too fast too low explodey" zone and to get that nice precise landing within sight of the *Dipperkraft*! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Well, it shouldn't take that much fuel to land in atmosphere... hopefully...

On the other hand, looking at my Minmus mining wreck (autopilot malfunction just above the ground - didn't check for one particular parameter going a bit too high and resulting in square root of negative number...), suicide burns may not be the best idea.

Still, I was expecting you to land this craft almost empty, given that it would ensure less heat on reentry, less terminal velocity and better controllability. But you can always overcompensate it with extra delta v, I guess.

In any case, let us all hope that the landing goes smoothly.

> 
> Sorry guys I was climbing a mountain yesterday.

I'll have to remember that one when the teacher asks for my homework...

> 
> I sense a "Looks like I picked the wrong week to quit hidrazine" joke aproaching fast ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Eve is not so bad. Just imagine how tough it would be to shake 'hydrazine' problem on Eeloo ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) The cold, loneliness and all that free ice around ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

> [http://i.imgur.com/DPdnLiv.png](http://i.imgur.com/DPdnLiv.png)

Is that a Kelty Trekker 65?
^^man knows his frame packs. It is indeed a Kelty, not sure the model.
I have a newer '65, and my friend from Scouts has the same model, but older. It looked like the same kind you had. Can the old ones store LFO?
IIRC have a Kelty pack from BSA. Was ziplining yesterday,what fun.

> 
> I have a newer '65, and my friend from Scouts has the same model, but older. It looked like the same kind you had. **Can the old ones store LFO?**

Wait what??? They can store *ROCKET FUEL??*

Oh! You changed your avatar!

And yes, I think they can. Not for very long, though.

![41MUQunnGqL._SX425_.jpg](http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41MUQunnGqL._SX425_.jpg)

Anything can be rocket fuel, if you try hard enough!

> 
> Oh! You changed your avatar!
> And yes, I think they can. Not for very long, though.
> 
> [http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41MUQunnGqL._SX425_.jpg](http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41MUQunnGqL._SX425_.jpg)
> 
> Anything can be rocket fuel, if you try hard enough!

Yep, had it made for me. (I tried to make my own and it looked terrible ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) ) You like?

Also, I'm still confused, why did you say LFO? What did you mean? ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

> 
> Yep, had it made for me. (I tried to make my own and it looked terrible ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) ) You like?
> Also, I'm still confused, why did you say LFO? What did you mean? ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

Well, you could pour LF/O into a backpack. But it wouldn't work very well. Know what happens when you don't screw on the top to a fuel bottle correctly? Imagine that, but more. 

If you put it in a bottle, like above, it might work. Kerosene is stable at room temps, we use it on camping trips to light lanterns. (How it was used before Herr Von Braun.) As for the LOX, IDK how you'd store it.

Five pages...

![GKN6KfC.png](http://i.imgur.com/GKN6KfC.png)

![wOmLPvd.png](http://i.imgur.com/wOmLPvd.png)

![oX0C46O.png](http://i.imgur.com/oX0C46O.png)

![j3xfuKa.png](http://i.imgur.com/j3xfuKa.png)

![MGaDsXn.png](http://i.imgur.com/MGaDsXn.png)

So I think it's safe to say that wherever the landing ends up, it's significantly more than 30km--making Mikki the winner! **Mikki** please PM me with your idea, and if it's "reasonable" I'll do it! 

Also, major shoutout to **Parkaboy** for giving me the missing link I needed to use Free IVA and get those shots of Jeb in the Mk1 cockpit!

And I really tried to get closer. I really really did! But yeah, at 600 tons drag does not have a huge effect on the M7's momentum. If I'd sent *Kranefly* back to Gilly a second time I might have had enough fuel to slow down some more and get closer--but Dilsby called it correctly, we were bingo at that point and needed to shut down to save some for a (hopefully) happy landing. 

We'll get to that part (the actual landing) next time. Will the M7 be in few enough pieces to lift off again? Stay tuned and find out!

> Wait a minute -- is that *good* good, or Air Service "good".

Literally LOL'd at that one.

Looks like it should be a happy landing as long as Jeb left enough fuel. After all, he doesn't run out of fuel every time, does he?

Very happy landings!

And again - 'hydrazine' fuelled space shanty ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Good to know our soon-to-be-rescued trio is having such good time on Eve of all places ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Haha!

That was intense.

Because I'm almost sure it's impossible.

i'm not sure how relevant this is but after drinking all this hydrazine the stranded trio at Eve will eventually have dreams like this trailer

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5z2-ODBw5FA?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Kuzz, amazing story, can't wait for the trip to the rescue rocket and the ascent

And then they start singing something like this:

1 Kerbal waits for EAV,

1 Kerbal counts its delta V.

You send him one,

it lands upside down...

2 Kerbals wait for EAV.

2 Kerbals wait for EAV,

2 Kerbals count its delta V.

You send them one,

but it falls apart...

3 Kerbals wait for EAV.

3 Kerbals wait for EAV,

3 Kerbals count its delta V.

You send them one,

but half burns up...

4 Kerbals wait for EAV.

4 Kerbals wait for EAV,

4 Kerbals count its delta V.

You send them one,

but an engine gets smashed...

5 Kerbals wait for EAV.

...

Hum, I sincerily hope that their "hydrazine" is not carbonated. 5 atmo compression on one of those will surely give out some monumental burps as soon as they get back to 1 atmo ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
